chrom.title: Chromosome
chrom.description: name of the chromosome or scaffold; chromosome names without a 'chr'

ensgid.title: ENSEMBL gene ID
ensgid.description: The stable identifier for the gene

gene_version.title: ENSEMBL gene version
gene_version.description: The stable identifier version for the gene

gene_symbol.title: Gene symbol
gene_symbol.description: The official symbol of this gene
gene_symbol.comments: Present NCBI or HUGO Name as the default

chrom_hg19.title: Chromosome (hg19)
chrom_hg19.description: name of the chromosome or scaffold in hg19; chromosome names without a 'chr'

items.title: Cytoband
items.description: cytoband

gene_summary.title: Gene summary
gene_summary.comments: Default=CGAP KB; RefSeq if not available

hgnc_id.title: HGNC ID
hgnc_id.description: A unique ID provided by the HGNC for each gene with an approved symbol.

name.title: Gene full name
name.description: The full gene name approved by the HGNC.

items.title: RefSeq
items.description: The Reference Sequence (RefSeq) collection

items.title: CCDS
items.description: The Consensus CDS (CCDS) project: a collaborative effort to identify a core set of human and mouse protein coding regions that are consistently annotated and of high quality

items.title: UniProt
items.description: UniProt accession number

items.title: MGI
items.description: Mouse Genome Informatics Database
items.comments: We need to look at one mouse db at least

items.title: OMIM
items.description: Online Mendelian Inheritance in Man (OMIM)

orphanet.title: OrphaNet
orphanet.description: portal for rare diseases and orphan drugs

items.title: PDB
items.description: The Protein Data Bank (PDB) [1] is a database for the three-dimensional structural data of large biological molecules, such as proteins and nucleic acids.

items.title: BioGrid
items.description: BioGRID is an interaction repository with data compiled through comprehensive curation efforts.

items.title: STRING
items.description: STRING (Search Tool for the Retrieval of Interacting Genes/Proteins) is a biological database and web resource of known and predicted protein–protein interactions.

GeneCards.title: GeneCards
GeneCards.description: a database of human genes that provides genomic, proteomic, transcriptomic, genetic and functional information on all known and predicted human genes.

items.title: PharmGKB
items.description: a publicly available, online knowledgebase responsible for the aggregation, curation, integration and dissemination of knowledge regarding the impact of human genetic variation on drug response.

items.title: GeneReviews
items.description: GeneReviews

Pathway_KEGG_id.title: KEGG
Pathway_KEGG_id.description: ID(s) of the Pathway(s) the gene belongs to (from KEGG)

Pathway_KEGG_full.title: KEGG pathway
Pathway_KEGG_full.description: Full name(s) of the Pathway(s) the gene belongs to (from KEGG)

items.title: GWAS catalog trait
items.description: Trait(s) the gene associated with (from GWAS catalog)

items.title: GWAS catalog trait PMID
items.description: Trait(s) the gene associated with (from GWAS catalog)

RVIS_ExAC.title: RVIS(ExAC)
RVIS_ExAC.description: ExAC-based RVIS; setting 'common' MAF filter at 0.05% in at least one of the six individual ethnic strata from ExAC.

RVIS_percentile_ExAC.title: RVIS(ExAC) percentile
RVIS_percentile_ExAC.description: Genome-Wide percentile for the new ExAC-based RVIS; setting 'common' MAF filter at 0.05% in at least one of the six individual ethnic strata from ExAC.

GDP.title: Gene damage prediction (all disease-causing genes)
GDP.description: gene damage prediction (low/medium/high) by GDI for all diseases

MGI_mouse_gene.title: Mouse gene (MGI)
MGI_mouse_gene.description: Homolog mouse gene name from MGI

MGI_mouse_phenotype.title: Mouse phenotype (MGI)
MGI_mouse_phenotype.description: Phenotype description for the homolog mouse gene from MGI

Marrvel.title: Marrvel
Marrvel.description: Integrated information from six human genetic databases and seven model organism databases

s_het.title: s_het
s_het.description: s_het estimates based on ExAC should be here http://genetics.bwh.harvard.edu/genescores/

gene_source.title: Gene source
gene_source.description: The annotation source for this gene

locus_type.title: Locus type
locus_type.description: Specifies the genetic class of each gene entry.

items.title: Alias gene symbol
items.description: Alias gene symbol

items.title: Alias gene name
items.description: Alias gene name

items.title: Previous gene symbol
items.description: This field displays any symbols that were previously HGNC-approved nomenclature.

items.title: Previous gene name
items.description: This field displays any names that were previously HGNC-approved nomenclature.

items.title: PubMed
items.description: PubMed

items.title: LRG
items.description: A Locus Reference Genomic (LRG) record contains stable reference sequences that are used for reporting sequence variants with clinical implications

cosmic.title: Cosmic
cosmic.description: Catalog of somatic mutations in cancer

homeodb.title: HomeoDB
homeodb.description: a database of homeobox gene diversity

snornabase.title: snoRNABase
snornabase.description: database of human H/ACA and C/D box snoRNAs

items.title: ENZYME
items.description: ENZYME database

items.title: UinRef 100% sequence identity genes
items.description: UniRef100 combines identical sequences and sub-fragments with 11 or more residues from any organism into a single UniRef entry.

items.title: UinRef 90% sequence identity genes
items.description: UniRef90 is built by clustering UniRef100 sequences such that each cluster is composed of sequences that have at least 90% sequence identity to, and 80% overlap with, the longest sequence (a.k.a. seed sequence).

items.title: UinRef 50% sequence identity genes
items.description: UniRef50 is built by clustering UniRef90 seed sequences that have at least 50% sequence identity to, and 80% overlap with, the longest sequence in the cluster.

items.title: UniParc
items.description: The UniProt Archive (UniParc) is a comprehensive and non-redundant database that contains most of the publicly available protein sequences in the world.

items.title: MINT
items.description: The Molecular INTeraction Database

items.title: ChEMBL
items.description: Manually curated database of bioactive molecules with drug-like properties.

items.title: DrugBank
items.description: The DrugBank database is a bioinformatics and cheminformatics resource that combines detailed drug data with comprehensive drug target information.

items.title: BioMuta
items.description: A single-nucleotide variation (SNV) and disease association database where variations are mapped to genomes and RefSeq nucleotide entries, and unified through UniProtKB/Swiss-Prot positional coordinates.

items.title: Human Protein Atlas
items.description: Human Protein Atlas

items.title: eggNOG
items.description: It is based on the original idea of COGs and expands that idea to non-supervised orthologous groups constructed from numerous organisms.

items.title: HOGENOM
items.description: Database of Complete Genome Homologous Genes Families

items.title: KEGG Ontology
items.description: KEGG Ontology

items.title: OrthoDB
items.description: OrthoDB presents a catalog of orthologous protein-coding genes across vertebrates, arthropods, fungi, plants, and bacteria.

items.title: TreeFam
items.description: Database of animal gene trees

items.title: ChiTaRS
items.description: Database of chimeric transcripts and RNA-seq data

items.title: UniProt
items.description: UniProt is a freely accessible database of protein sequence and functional information, many entries being derived from genome sequencing projects.

items.title: Gene Ontology
items.description: Gene Ontology

items.title: ComplexPortal
items.description: The Complex Portal is a manually curated, encyclopaedic resource of macromolecular complexes from a number of key model organisms.

items.title: TCDB
items.description: Functional and Phylogenetic Classification of Membrane Transport Proteins

BioCyc.title: BioCyc
BioCyc.description: BioCyc is a collection of 17043 Pathway/Genome Databases (PGDBs), plus software tools for exploring them.

items.title: UniPathway
items.description: UniPathway

items.title: PATRIC
items.description: PATRIC, the Pathosystems Resource Integration Center, provides integrated data and analysis tools to support biomedical research on bacterial infectious diseases.

Pathway_BioCarta_short.title: BioCarta
Pathway_BioCarta_short.description: Short name of the Pathway(s) the gene belongs to (from BioCarta)

Pathway_BioCarta_full.title: BioCarta pathway
Pathway_BioCarta_full.description: Full name(s) of the Pathway(s) the gene belongs to (from BioCarta)

Pathway_ConsensusPathDB.title: Pathway(ConsensusPathDB)
Pathway_ConsensusPathDB.description: Pathway(s) the gene belongs to (from ConsensusPathDB)

items.title: Function description
items.description: Function description of the gene (from Uniprot)

items.title: Disease description
items.description: Disease(s) the gene caused or associated with (from Uniprot)

items.title: MIM Phenotype ID
items.description: MIM id(s) of the phenotype the gene caused or associated with (from Uniprot)

MIM_disease.title: MIM Disease
MIM_disease.description: MIM disease name(s) with MIM id(s) in '[]' (from Uniprot)

items.title: Orphanet Disorder ID
items.description: Orphanet Number of the disorder the gene caused or associated with

items.title: Orphanet Disorder
items.description: Disorder name from Orphanet

items.title: Orphanet association type
items.description: the type of association beteen the gene and the disorder

items.title: GO biological process
items.description: GO terms for biological process

items.title: GO cellular component
items.description: GO terms for cellular component

items.title: GO molecular function
items.description: GO terms for molecular function

items.title: Tissue specificity
items.description: Tissue specificity description from Uniprot

items.title: Expression from egenetics data
items.description: Tissues/organs the gene expressed in (egenetics data from BioMart)

items.title: Expression from GNF/Atlas data
items.description: Tissues/organs the gene expressed in (GNF/Atlas data from BioMart)

items.title: IntAct interaction
items.description: The number of other genes this gene interacting with (from IntAct).

items.title: BioGRID interaction
items.description: The number of other genes this gene interacting with (from BioGRID)

items.title: ConsensusPathDB interaction
items.description: The number of other genes this gene interacting with (from ConsensusPathDB).

P_HI.title: P_HI
P_HI.description: Estimated probability of haploinsufficiency of the gene(from doi:10.1371/journal.pgen.1001154)

HIPred_score.title: HIPred_score
HIPred_score.description: Estimated probability of haploinsufficiency of the gene(from doi:10.1093/bioinformatics/btx028)

HIPred.title: HIPred
HIPred.description: HIPred prediction of haploinsufficiency of the gene. Y(es) or N(o).(from doi:10.1093/bioinformatics/btx028)

GHIS.title: GHIS
GHIS.description: A score predicting the gene haploinsufficiency. The higher the score the more likely the gene is haploinsufficient. (from doi: 10.1093/nar/gkv474)

P_rec.title: P_rec
P_rec.description: Estimated probability that gene is a recessive disease gene (from DOI:10.1126/science.1215040)

Known_rec_info.title: Known recessive status
Known_rec_info.description: Known recessive status of the gene (f2rom DOI:10.1126/science.1215040);lof-tolerant = seen in homozygous state in at least one 1000G individual;recessive = known OMIM recessive disease

RVIS_EVS.title: RVIS(ESP6500)
RVIS_EVS.description: Residual Variation Intolerance Score, a measure of intolerance of mutational burden, the higher the score the more tolerant to mutational burden the gene is. Based on EVS (ESP6500) data. from doi:10.1371/journal.pgen.1003709

RVIS_percentile_EVS.title: RVIS(ESP6500) percentile
RVIS_percentile_EVS.description: The percentile rank of the gene based on RVIS, the higher the percentile the more tolerant to mutational burden the gene is. Based on EVS (ESP6500) data.

LoF-FDR_ExAC.title: LoF-FDR (ExAC)
LoF-FDR_ExAC.description: A gene's corresponding FDR p-value for preferential LoF depletion among the ExAC population. Lower FDR corresponds with genes that are increasingly depleted of LoF variants.

ExAC_pLI.title: pLI (ExAC)
ExAC_pLI.description: the probability of being loss-of-function intolerant (intolerant of both heterozygous and homozygous lof variants) based on ExAC r0.3 data

ExAC_pRec.title: pRec (ExAC)
ExAC_pRec.description: the probability of being intolerant of homozygous, but not heterozygous lof variants based on ExAC r0.3 data

ExAC_pNull.title: pNull (ExAC)
ExAC_pNull.description: the probability of being tolerant of both heterozygous and homozygous lof variants based on ExAC r0.3 data

ExAC_nonTCGA_pLI.title: pLI (ExAC nonTCGA)
ExAC_nonTCGA_pLI.description: the probability of being loss-of-function intolerant (intolerant of both heterozygous and homozygous lof variants) based on ExAC r0.3 nonTCGA subset

ExAC_nonTCGA_pRec.title: pRec (ExAC nonTCGA)
ExAC_nonTCGA_pRec.description: the probability of being intolerant of homozygous, but not heterozygous lof variants based on ExAC r0.3 nonTCGA subset

ExAC_nonTCGA_pNull.title: pNull (ExAC nonTCGA)
ExAC_nonTCGA_pNull.description: the probability of being tolerant of both heterozygous and homozygous lof variants based on ExAC r0.3 nonTCGA subset

ExAC_nonpsych_pLI.title: pLI (ExAC nonpsych)
ExAC_nonpsych_pLI.description: the probability of being loss-of-function intolerant (intolerant of both heterozygous and homozygous lof variants) based on ExAC r0.3 nonpsych subset

ExAC_nonpsych_pRec.title: pRec (ExAC nonpsych)
ExAC_nonpsych_pRec.description: the probability of being intolerant of homozygous, but not heterozygous lof variants based on ExAC r0.3 nonpsych subset

ExAC_nonpsych_pNull.title: pNull (ExAC nonpsych)
ExAC_nonpsych_pNull.description: the probability of being tolerant of both heterozygous and homozygous lof variants based on ExAC r0.3 nonpsych subset

gnomAD_pLI.title: pLI (gnomAD)
gnomAD_pLI.description: the probability of being loss-of-function intolerant (intolerant of both heterozygous and homozygous lof variants) based on gnomAD 2.1 data

gnomAD_pRec.title: pRec (gnomAD)
gnomAD_pRec.description: the probability of being intolerant of homozygous, but not heterozygous lof variants based on gnomAD 2.1 data

gnomAD_pNull.title: pNull (gnomAD)
gnomAD_pNull.description: the probability of being tolerant of both heterozygous and homozygous lof variants based on gnomAD 2.1 data

ExAC_del.score.title: Deletion intolerance z-core
ExAC_del.score.description: Winsorised deletion intolerance z-score based on ExAC r0.3.1 CNV data

ExAC_dup.score.title: Duplication intolerance z-score
ExAC_dup.score.description: Winsorised duplication intolerance z-score based on ExAC r0.3.1 CNV data

ExAC_cnv.score.title: CNV intolerance z-score
ExAC_cnv.score.description: Winsorised cnv intolerance z-score based on ExAC r0.3.1 CNV data

ExAC_cnv_flag.title: CNV flag
ExAC_cnv_flag.description: Gene is in a known region of recurrent CNVs mediated by tandem segmental duplications and intolerance scores are more likely to be biased or noisy from ExAC r0.3.1 CNV release

GDI.title: Gene damage index (GDI)
GDI.description: gene damage index score, a genome-wide, gene-level metric of the mutational damage that has accumulated in the general population from doi: 10.1073/pnas.1518646112. The higher the score the less likely the gene is to be responsible for monogenic diseases.

GDP_mendelian.title: Gene damage prediction (all Mendelian disease-causing genes)
GDP_mendelian.schema_title: Gene damage prediction (all Mendelian disease-causing genes)
GDP_mendelian.description: gene damage prediction (low/medium/high) by GDI for all Mendelian diseases

GDP_mendelian_AD.title: Gene damage prediction (Mendelian AD disease-causing genes)
GDP_mendelian_AD.schema_title: Gene damage prediction (Mendelian AD disease-causing genes)
GDP_mendelian_AD.description: gene damage prediction (low/medium/high) by GDI for Mendelian autosomal dominant diseases

GDP_mendelian_AR.title: Gene damage prediction (Mendelian AR disease-causing genes)
GDP_mendelian_AR.schema_title: Gene damage prediction (Mendelian AR disease-causing genes)
GDP_mendelian_AR.description: gene damage prediction (low/medium/high) by GDI for Mendelian autosomal recessive diseases

GDP_PID.title: Gene damage prediction (all PID disease-causing genes)
GDP_PID.schema_title: Gene damage prediction (all PID disease-causing genes)
GDP_PID.description: gene damage prediction (low/medium/high) by GDI for all primary immunodeficiency diseases

GDP_PID_AD.title: Gene damage prediction (PID AD disease-causing genes)
GDP_PID_AD.schema_title: Gene damage prediction (PID AD disease-causing genes)
GDP_PID_AD.description: gene damage prediction (low/medium/high) by GDI for primary immunodeficiency autosomal dominant diseases

GDP_PID_AR.title: Gene damage prediction (PID AR disease-causing genes)
GDP_PID_AR.schema_title: Gene damage prediction (PID AR disease-causing genes)
GDP_PID_AR.description: gene damage prediction (low/medium/high) by GDI for primary immunodeficiency autosomal recessive diseases

GDP_cancer.title: Gene damage prediction (all cancer disease-causing genes)
GDP_cancer.schema_title: Gene damage prediction (all cancer disease-causing genes)
GDP_cancer.description: gene damage prediction (low/medium/high) by GDI for all cancer disease

GDP_cancer_rec.title: Gene damage prediction (cancer recessive disease-causing genes)
GDP_cancer_rec.schema_title: Gene damage prediction (cancer recessive disease-causing genes)
GDP_cancer_rec.description: gene damage prediction (low/medium/high) by GDI for cancer recessive disease

GDP_cancer_dom.title: Gene damage prediction (cancer dominant disease-causing genes)
GDP_cancer_dom.schema_title: Gene damage prediction (cancer dominant disease-causing genes)
GDP_cancer_dom.description: gene damage prediction (low/medium/high) by GDI for cancer dominant disease

LoFtool_score.title: LoF
LoFtool_score.description: a percentile score for gene intolerance to functional change. The lower the score the higher gene intolerance to functional change. For details see doi: 10.1093/bioinformatics/btv602.

SORVA_LOF_MAF0.005_HetOrHom.title: SORVA_LOF_MAF0.005_HetOrHom
SORVA_LOF_MAF0.005_HetOrHom.description: the fraction of individuals in the 1000 Genomes Project data (N=2504) who are either Heterozygote or Homozygote of LOF SNVs whose MAF<0.005. This fraction is from a method for ranking genes based on mutational burden called SORVA (Significance Of Rare VAriants). Please see doi: 10.1101/103218 for details.

SORVA_LOF_MAF0.005_HomOrCompoundHet.title: SORVA_LOF_MAF0.005_HomOrCompoundHet
SORVA_LOF_MAF0.005_HomOrCompoundHet.description: the fraction of individuals in the 1000 Genomes Project data (N=2504) who are either Compound Heterozygote or Homozygote of LOF SNVs whose MAF<0.005. This fraction is from a method for ranking genes based on mutational burden called SORVA (Significance Of Rare VAriants). Please see doi: 10.1101/103218 for details.

SORVA_LOF_MAF0.001_HetOrHom.title: SORVA_LOF_MAF0.001_HetOrHom
SORVA_LOF_MAF0.001_HetOrHom.description: the fraction of individuals in the 1000 Genomes Project data (N=2504) who are either Heterozygote or Homozygote of LOF SNVs whose MAF<0.001. This fraction is from a method for ranking genes based on mutational burden called SORVA (Significance Of Rare VAriants). Please see doi: 10.1101/103218 for details.

SORVA_LOF_MAF0.001_HomOrCompoundHet.title: SORVA_LOF_MAF0.001_HomOrCompoundHet
SORVA_LOF_MAF0.001_HomOrCompoundHet.description: the fraction of individuals in the 1000 Genomes Project data (N=2504) who are either Compound Heterozygote or Homozygote of LOF SNVs whose MAF<0.001. This fraction is from a method for ranking genes based on mutational burden called SORVA (Significance Of Rare VAriants). Please see doi: 10.1101/103218 for details.

SORVA_LOForMissense_MAF0.005_HetOrHom.title: SORVA_LOForMissense_MAF0.005_HetOrHom
SORVA_LOForMissense_MAF0.005_HetOrHom.description: the fraction of individuals in the 1000 Genomes Project data (N=2504) who are either Heterozygote or Homozygote of LOF or missense SNVs whose MAF<0.005. This fraction is from a method for ranking genes based on mutational burden called SORVA (Significance Of Rare VAriants). Please see doi: 10.1101/103218 for details.

SORVA_LOForMissense_MAF0.005_HomOrCompou.title: SORVA_LOForMissense_MAF0.005_HomOrCompoundHet
SORVA_LOForMissense_MAF0.005_HomOrCompou.description: the fraction of individuals in the 1000 Genomes Project data (N=2504) who are either Compound Heterozygote or Homozygote of LOF or missense SNVs whose MAF<0.005. This fraction is from a method for ranking genes based on mutational burden called SORVA (Significance Of Rare VAriants). Please see doi: 10.1101/103218 for details.

SORVA_LOForMissense_MAF0.001_HetOrHom.title: SORVA_LOForMissense_MAF0.001_HetOrHom
SORVA_LOForMissense_MAF0.001_HetOrHom.description: the fraction of individuals in the 1000 Genomes Project data (N=2504) who are either Heterozygote or Homozygote of LOF or missense SNVs whose MAF<0.001. This fraction is from a method for ranking genes based on mutational burden called SORVA (Significance Of Rare VAriants). Please see doi: 10.1101/103218 for details.

SORVA_LOForMissense_MAF0.001_HomOrCompou.title: SORVA_LOForMissense_MAF0.001_HomOrCompoundHet
SORVA_LOForMissense_MAF0.001_HomOrCompou.description: the fraction of individuals in the 1000 Genomes Project data (N=2504) who are either Compound Heterozygote or Homozygote of LOF or missense SNVs whose MAF<0.001. This fraction is from a method for ranking genes based on mutational burden called SORVA (Significance Of Rare VAriants). Please see doi: 10.1101/103218 for details.

Essential_gene.title: Essential gene (MGI)
Essential_gene.description: Essential ('E') or Non-essential phenotype-changing ('N') based on Mouse Genome Informatics database. from doi:10.1371/journal.pgen.1003484

Essential_gene_CRISPR.title: Essential gene (CRISPR)
Essential_gene_CRISPR.description: Essential ('E') or Non-essential phenotype-changing ('N') based on large scale CRISPR experiments. from doi: 10.1126/science.aac7041

Essential_gene_CRISPR2.title: Essential gene (CRISPR2)
Essential_gene_CRISPR2.description: Essential ('E'), context-Specific essential ('S'), or Non-essential phenotype-changing ('N') based on large scale CRISPR experiments. from http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.cell.2015.11.015

Essential_gene_gene-trap.title: Essential gene (gene-trap)
Essential_gene_gene-trap.description: Essential ('E'), HAP1-Specific essential ('H'), KBM7-Specific essential ('K'), or Non-essential phenotype-changing ('N'), based on large scale mutagenesis experiments. from doi: 10.1126/science.aac7557

Gene_indispensability_score.title: Gene_indispensability_score
Gene_indispensability_score.description: A probability prediction of the gene being essential. From doi:10.1371/journal.pcbi.1002886

Gene_indispensability_pred.title: Gene_indispensability_pred
Gene_indispensability_pred.description: Essential ('E') or loss-of-function tolerant ('N') based on Gene_indispensability_score.

ZFIN_zebrafish_gene.title: Zebrafish gene (ZFIN)
ZFIN_zebrafish_gene.description: Homolog zebrafish gene name from ZFIN

ZFIN_zebrafish_structure.title: Zebrafish structure (ZFIN)
ZFIN_zebrafish_structure.description: Affected structure of the homolog zebrafish gene from ZFIN

ZFIN_zebrafish_phenotype_quality.title: Zebrafish phenotype quality (ZFIN)
ZFIN_zebrafish_phenotype_quality.description: Phenotype description for the homolog zebrafish gene from ZFIN

ZFIN_zebrafish_phenotype_tag.title: Zebrafish phenotype tag (ZFIN)
ZFIN_zebrafish_phenotype_tag.description: Phenotype tag for the homolog zebrafish gene from ZFIN

pLI.title: pLI
pLI.description: the probability of being loss-of-function intolerant (intolerant of both heterozygous and homozygous lof variants) based on gnomAD v2
